p: DPPH inhibition potential of CTN were 65 ± 1.35***, 50 ± 1.1***, 44 ± 0.5***, 37 ± 0.4***, 31 ± 1.0***, and 29 ± 1.4*** at concentration 1000, 500, 250, 125, 62.5, and 31.25 µg/mL with their IC 50 values 65µg/mL. While the ABTS free radical scavenging potential of CTN were 59 ± 1.5**, 46 ± 1.8***, 41 ± 0.8***, 36 ± 1.4***, 28 ± 1.2***, and 21 ± 1.5*** at concentration 1000, 500, 250, 125, 62.5, and 31.25 µg/mL with IC 50 values 72µg/mL. The results indicated in Figure 1A,B and Table S1 indicate that CTN has comparable % inhibition potential of the used free radicals to standard ascorbic acid against (ascorbic acid IC 50; 30 µg/mL against DPPH and IC 50; 32 µg/mL against ABTS). The experiments have been performed in three replicates.
